poem:
**Slapping the Wind**

Healer's hand strikes
palm against failing flesh,
kung fu whispers and hermit's
breath mingling in the air.
Diabetes sleeps, dreamless
fields of blood—
a woman wakes not to dawn
but to silence,
where no slaps echo,
only the stillness 
of an unhealed heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Healer accused of manslaughter ‘learnt slapping therapy from kung fu masters’ An alternative healer accused of the manslaughter of a British woman with diabetes who died at his slapping therapy workshop has told a jury that he learned his method from kung fu masters and hermits in China. Hongchi Xiao said paida lajin therapy could combat all diseases including diabetes but also insisted he would never tell a person with type 1 diabetes to stop". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Healer accused of manslaughter ‘learnt slapping therapy from kung fu masters’ An alternative healer accused of the manslaughter of a British woman with diabetes who died at his slapping therapy workshop has told a jury that he learned his method from kung fu masters and hermits in China. Hongchi Xiao said paida lajin therapy could combat all diseases including diabetes but also insisted he would never tell a person with type 1 diabetes to stop
